intro: Pouzolzia latistipula, commonly known as the broad-tipped pouzolzia, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Pouzolzia latistipula typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open habitats.
